title: Rapid City, South Dakota
summary: Rapid City (Lakota: Mni Lúzahaŋ Otȟúŋwahe;[6] "Swift Water City") is the second most populous city in South Dakota and the county seat of Pennington County.[7] Named after Rapid Creek, where the settlement developed, it is in western South Dakota, on the Black Hills' eastern slope. The population was 74,703 as of the 2020 Census.[8]
